title: Hollywood Studios Worry About New AI Video Tool
summary: A new AI tool called Seedance 2.0 can make very realistic videos from simple text prompts. People are using it to create clips with famous actors like Tom Cruise and Brad Pitt or characters from shows like Friends. Hollywood studios are upset because these videos use their movies and TV shows without permission. They say Seedance is breaking copyright laws, which protect creators' work. The tool's owner, ByteDance, says it respects copyright and is trying to fix the problem. Some writers and creators are scared this AI could take away their jobs because it makes videos that look professional easily.

background_read: This article talks about a new technology called AI that can create videos. AI stands for artificial intelligence, which means computers can think and create like humans. In entertainment, people make movies and shows, and they have rules called copyright to protect their work. When someone uses their characters or scenes without asking, it's like copying homework without permission. Big companies in Hollywood, like Disney and Netflix, are worried because this AI tool might copy their stuff and hurt their business. It's important to respect creators' hard work and follow the laws.
